alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon; Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 07 at 11:23PM EDT until April 08 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New Jersey... South Branch Raritan River At Stanton affecting Somerset and Hunterdon Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Branch Raritan River At Stanton. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 5.0 feet, Minor low land flooding downstream of gauge. At 8.0 feet, Right bank and approach to bridge is flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 8.7 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.6 feet on 08/23/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (2 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Stg Time Date South Branch Rar Stanton 8.0 8.0 Thu 11 p 6.1 4.6 8.7 8am 4/08 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued Friday morning by 1130 AM EDT.
